00035 #include <resample.h>
00036 
00037 ResSt newPolyPhaseFIR( int filterMemoryBuffLength, int indexfiltMemBuf,
00038                        int interpFactor, int filterPhaseNum, int deciFactor )
00039 {
00040     ResSt tmp = ( ResSt ) safealloc( 1, sizeof( resampler ), "PF Resampler" );
00041 
00042     tmp->indexfiltMemBuf = indexfiltMemBuf;
00043     tmp->interpFactor = interpFactor;
00044     tmp->filterPhaseNum = filterPhaseNum;
00045     tmp->deciFactor = deciFactor;
00046     tmp->numFiltTaps = 31 * deciFactor;
00047     tmp->filterMemoryBuffLength =
00048         nblock2( max( filterMemoryBuffLength, tmp->numFiltTaps ) );
00049     tmp->mask = tmp->filterMemoryBuffLength - 1;
00050     tmp->filterMemoryBuff =
00051         ( COMPLEX * ) safealloc( tmp->filterMemoryBuffLength,
00052                                  sizeof( COMPLEX ),
00053                                  "Filter buff: resampler" );
00054     tmp->filter =
00055         newFIR_Lowpass_REAL( 0.45f / ( REAL ) deciFactor,
00056                              ( REAL ) interpFactor, 31 * interpFactor );
00057     return tmp;
00058 }
00059 
00060 void delPolyPhaseFIR( ResSt resst )
00061 {
00062     if ( resst )
00063     {
00064         delFIR_Lowpass_REAL( resst->filter );
00065         safefree( ( char * ) resst->filterMemoryBuff );
00066         safefree( ( char * ) resst );
00067     }
00068 }
00069 
00070 /******************************************************************************
00071 * CALLING PARAMETERS:
00072 * Name          Use    Description
00073 * ____          ___    ___________
00074 * *input               pointer to input COMPLEX data array
00075 * *output              pointer to output COMPLEX data array
00076 * RealFIR filter           pointer to filter coefficients array
00077 * *filterMemoryBuff    pointer to buffer used as filter memory. Initialized
00078 *                      all data to 0 before 1st call.  length is calculated
00079 *                      from numFiltTaps
00080 * filterMemoryBuffLength length of filterMemoryBuff
00081 * inputArrayLength     length of input array :note that "output" may differ
00082 *                      in length
00083 * numFiltTaps          number of filter taps in array "filtcoeff": <filterMemoryBuffLength
00084 * indexfiltMemBuf     index to where next input sample is to be stored in
00085 *                      "filterMemoryBuff",initalized 0 to before first call
00086 * interpFactor         interpolation factor: output rate = input rate *
00087 *                      "interpFactor" / "deciFactor".
00088 * filterPhaseNum      filter phase number (index), initialized to 0 before
00089 *                      first call
00090 * deciFactor           decimation factor:
00091 *                      output rate = (input rate * "interpFactor"/"deciFactor")
00092 * numOutputSamples    number of output samples placed in array "output"
00093 *
00094 * CALLED BY:
00095 *
00096 * RETURN VALUE:
00097 * Name      Description
00098 * ____      ___________
00099 * none
00100 *
00101 * DESCRIPTION: This function is used to change the sampling rate of the data.
00102 *              The input is first upsampled to a multiple of the desired
00103 *              sampling rate and then down sampled to the desired sampling rate.
00104 *
00105 *              Ex. If we desire a 7200 Hz sampling rate for a signal that has
00106 *                  been sampled at 8000 Hz the signal can first be upsampled
00107 *                  by a factor of 9 which brings it up to 72000 Hz and then
00108 *                  down sampled by a factor of 10 which results in a sampling
00109 *                  rate of 7200 Hz.
00110 *
00111 * NOTES:
00112 *        Also, the "*filterMemoryBuff" MUST be 2^N REALs long. This
00113 *        routine uses circular addressing on this buffer assuming that
00114 *        it is 2^N REALs in length.
00115 */
00116 
00117 void PolyPhaseFIR( ResSt resst )
00118 {
00119     int i,
00120         j,
00121         jj,
00122         k;
00123     COMPLEX *outptr;
00124 
00125     resst->numOutputSamples = 0;
00126 
00127     for ( i = 0; i < resst->inputArrayLength; i++ )
00128     {
00129 
00130         //save data in circular buffer
00131         resst->filterMemoryBuff[resst->indexfiltMemBuf] = resst->input[i];
00132         j = resst->indexfiltMemBuf;
00133         jj = j;
00134 
00135         // circular addressing
00136         resst->indexfiltMemBuf = ( resst->indexfiltMemBuf + 1 ) & resst->mask;
00137 
00138         // loop through each filter phase: interpolate then decimate
00139         while ( resst->filterPhaseNum < resst->interpFactor )
00140         {
00141             j = jj;
00142             outptr = resst->output + resst->numOutputSamples;
00143             *outptr = cxzero;
00144 
00145             // convolution
00146             for ( k = resst->filterPhaseNum; k < resst->numFiltTaps;
00147                   k += resst->interpFactor )
00148             {
00149                 *outptr =
00150                     Cadd( *outptr,
00151                           Cscl( resst->filterMemoryBuff[j],
00152                                 FIRtap( resst->filter, k ) ) );
00153 
00154                 //circular adressing
00155                 j = ( j + resst->mask ) & resst->mask;
00156             }
00157 
00158             // scale
00159             *outptr = Cscl( *outptr, ( REAL ) resst->interpFactor );
00160             resst->numOutputSamples += 1;
00161 
00162             // increment interpolation phase # by decimation factor
00163             resst->filterPhaseNum += ( resst->deciFactor );
00164         }
00165 
00166         resst->filterPhaseNum -= resst->interpFactor;
00167 
00168     }
00169 }
